FuncDef: The display isis avoid-microloop information command displays anti-micro-loop information.
CLIs: display isis [ <process-id> ] avoid-microloop information [ ipv6 ] [ level-1 | level-2 ] [ systemid <systemid> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of a process whose anti-micro-loop information is to be displayed.
If this parameter is not configured, anti-micro-loop information of all processes is displayed.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.

Displays anti-micro-loop information in IPv6 topology.
-

Displays anti-micro-loop information on nodes in Level-1 areas.
-

Displays anti-micro-loop information on nodes in Level-2 areas.
If no level is specified, anti-micro-loop information of nodes in all areas is displayed.
-

Specifies the system ID or pseudo node ID.
The value is a hexadecimal integer in the format of XXXX.XXXX.XXXX.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After the SR anti-micro-loop function is enabled, run the display isis avoid-microloop information command to view anti-micro-loop information on nodes. The command output contains the anti-micro-loop type, cause for failures, and date and time when the device entered and exited the anti-microloop state.
